intro: Barleria phaylopsis, commonly known as the blue barleria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower spikes. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which can last several months.
